title.narrative: Improving the Production and Commercialization of Ecological Products through Alliances in La Paz, Cochabamba, Oruro, Chuquisaca and Potosi

description.narrative: In Bolivia, the rapid growth of monocultures is causing the loss of native products, imbalances in production systems and a lack of recognition of the value of ecological products. The effects of this process are high levels of food insecurity, limited access to healthy products and worsening eating habits. Rural and peri-urban emigration has increased, resulting in many single-mother households. The project will provide seeds, tools, equipment and training for 1,068 families—many of them single-mother families—who will then pass on the gift to another 1,068 families. This project will also work with two national ecological producer organizations and a network of non-governmental organizations to promote agroecological production; commercialization; sustainable management of production resources; development of policies that guarantee the human right to adequate food; and train leaders. The organizations participating in the project have a long tradition of coordinated work and believe the project provides the possibility to combine efforts to achieve greater impact through the recognition of individual capabilities.
